revised_title: Investigating Extraordinary Meteors and Lights in the Sky
tldr: The author, Dr. Edmund Halley, examines various extraordinary meteors and lights in the sky, discussing their altitude, velocity, and possible causes. He also compares these phenomena to other historical events, such as the famous meteor observed over Italy in 1676. Halley suggests that these meteors may be collections of matter formed in the ether, which collide with Earth as it moves through its orbit.
